events.title: Birth of Albert Schweitzer
events.description: Albert Schweitzer was born in Kaysersberg in Alsace (then part of the German Empire). He would become a renowned theologian, physician, organist, and humanitarian, later awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1952.
events.significance: Nobel Peace Prize laureate whose philosophy of 'Reverence for Life' influenced ethics, humanitarian work, and modern medicine.

events.title: Casablanca Conference opens
events.description: World War II Allied conference held in Casablanca, Morocco, where Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill met to coordinate strategy and call for unconditional surrender of Axis powers.
events.significance: Shaped Allied war strategy and postwar policy by reinforcing the goal of unconditional surrender and setting the stage for coordination among the Allies.
